definition: the feat of mustering strength for a renewed effort, return to a former condition
details:
noun
- the feat of mustering strength for a renewed effort
= example: the feat of mustering strength for a renewed effort
= synonyms: rallying
- (sports) an unbroken sequence of several successive strokes
= example: (sports) an unbroken sequence of several successive strokes
= synonyms: exchange
- an automobile race run over public roads
- a large gathering of people intended to arouse enthusiasm
= synonyms: mass meeting
- a marked recovery of strength or spirits during an illness
verb
- return to a former condition
= synonyms: rebound
- harass with persistent criticism or carping
= synonyms: cod, ride, tease, rag, twit, taunt, bait, razz, tantalize, tantalise
- call to arms
= synonyms: call up, mobilize, mobilise
- gather or bring together
= synonyms: muster, summon, come up, muster up
- gather
= synonyms: drum up
